verses.kjv: James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes which are scattered abroad, greeting.
verses.ct: From James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the 12 tribes scattered across the world: greetings.

verses.kjv: My brethren, count it all joy when ye fall into divers temptations;
verses.ct: My brothers and sisters, consider it pure joy whenever you face all kinds of trials.

verses.kjv: Knowing this, that the trying of your faith worketh patience.
verses.ct: Understand that the testing of your faith produces endurance.

verses.kjv: But let patience have her perfect work, that ye may be perfect and entire, wanting nothing.
verses.ct: But let that endurance do its complete work in you, so that you become mature and whole, not lacking anything.

verses.kjv: If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, that giveth to all men liberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.
verses.ct: If any of you needs wisdom, ask God for it. He gives generously to everyone without finding fault, and it will be given to you.

verses.kjv: But let him ask in faith, nothing wavering. For he that wavereth is like a wave of the sea driven with the wind and tossed.
verses.ct: But you must ask with faith, without doubting. Someone who doubts is like an ocean wave tossed around and blown by the wind.

verses.kjv: For let not that man think that he shall receive any thing of the Lord.
verses.ct: That kind of person should not expect to receive anything from the Lord.

verses.kjv: A double minded man is unstable in all his ways.
verses.ct: A person with divided loyalties is unreliable in everything they do.

verses.kjv: Let the brother of low degree rejoice in that he is exalted:
verses.ct: Believers in humble circumstances should take pride in their high standing before God.

verses.kjv: But the rich, in that he is made low: because as the flower of the grass he shall pass away.
verses.ct: But the wealthy should take pride in being brought low, because they will fade away like a wildflower.

verses.kjv: For the sun is no sooner risen with a burning heat, but it withereth the grass, and the flower thereof falleth, and the grace of the fashion of it perisheth: so also shall the rich man fade away in his ways.
verses.ct: When the sun rises with its scorching heat, it dries up the plant, its flower drops off, and all its beauty is destroyed. In the same way, the rich person will wither away in the middle of their pursuits.

verses.kjv: Blessed is the man that endureth temptation: for when he is tried, he shall receive the crown of life, which the Lord hath promised to them that love him.
verses.ct: How happy is the person who holds up under trial, because after passing the test, they will receive the crown of life that the Lord has promised to those who love him.

verses.kjv: Let no man say when he is tempted, I am tempted of God: for God cannot be tempted with evil, neither tempteth he any man:
verses.ct: No one who is being tempted should say, 'God is tempting me.' God cannot be tempted by evil, and he himself does not tempt anyone.

verses.kjv: But every man is tempted, when he is drawn away of his own lust, and enticed.
verses.ct: Instead, each person is tempted when they are dragged away and lured by their own desires.

verses.kjv: Then when lust hath conceived, it bringeth forth sin: and sin, when it is finished, bringeth forth death.
verses.ct: Then desire, once it has taken root, gives birth to sin; and sin, when it has fully grown, gives birth to death.

verses.kjv: Do not err, my beloved brethren.
verses.ct: Don't be deceived, my dear brothers and sisters.

verses.kjv: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, and cometh down from the Father of lights, with whom is no variableness, neither shadow of turning.
verses.ct: Every good gift and every perfect gift comes down from above, from the Father of lights, who never changes and never casts a shifting shadow.

verses.kjv: Of his own will begat he us with the word of truth, that we should be a kind of firstfruits of his creatures.
verses.ct: By his own choice, he gave us new life through the word of truth, so that we would be a kind of firstfruits among everything he created.

verses.kjv: Wherefore, my beloved brethren, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath:
verses.ct: So then, my dear brothers and sisters, everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak, and slow to get angry.

verses.kjv: For the wrath of man worketh not the righteousness of God.
verses.ct: Because human anger does not produce the righteousness that God desires.

verses.kjv: Wherefore lay apart all filthiness and superfluity of naughtiness, and receive with meekness the engrafted word, which is able to save your souls.
verses.ct: So strip away every form of moral filth and the evil that overflows in your lives, and humbly accept the word that has been planted in you, which has the power to save your souls.

verses.kjv: But be ye doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving your own selves.
verses.ct: Put the word into practice — don't just listen to it. Otherwise, you're only fooling yourselves.

verses.kjv: For if any be a hearer of the word, and not a doer, he is like unto a man beholding his natural face in a glass:
verses.ct: Anyone who listens to the word but doesn't act on it is like someone who looks at their own reflection in a mirror,

verses.kjv: For he beholdeth himself, and goeth his way, and straightway forgetteth what manner of man he was.
verses.ct: takes a look at themselves, walks away, and immediately forgets what they looked like.

verses.kjv: But whoso looketh into the perfect law of liberty, and continueth therein, he being not a forgetful hearer, but a doer of the work, this man shall be blessed in his deed.
verses.ct: But whoever carefully studies the perfect law that brings freedom, and sticks with it — not just hearing and forgetting, but actually doing what it says — that person will be blessed in everything they do.

verses.kjv: If any man among you seem to be religious, and bridleth not his tongue, but deceiveth his own heart, this man’s religion is vain.
verses.ct: If anyone considers themselves religious but doesn't control their tongue, they are deceiving their own heart, and their religion is worthless.

verses.kjv: Pure religion and undefiled before God and the Father is this, To visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, and to keep himself unspotted from the world.
verses.ct: The kind of religion that God the Father considers pure and genuine is this: caring for orphans and widows in their suffering, and keeping yourself free from the corruption of the world.
